programme.title: Loup
programme.sub-title: Le loup qui voulait être fan de louve

programme.title: Canot cocasse
programme.desc: The travellers' treasure hunt Being goal-keeper has got Pam all stressed-out. During a treasure hunt, she realises that you gain nothing by putting too much pressure on yourself. Directed by: Mélanie Albert (season 5, Canada, 2021)

programme.title: L'héritage
programme.desc:
Seriously injured after an attempted murder, Christophe Perrin is unable to manage L'Héritage, the family oyster farm. Two of his daughters want to sell, but Tessa, the youngest, refuses and offers to take over. With the official investigation making no headway, the three sisters decide to lead their own investigations...

Directed by: Laurent Dussaux (France, 2019)

Screenplay: Pierre Lacan, Catherine Hoffmann

Cast: Thomas Jouannet (Inspector Julien Dubreuil), Barbara Cabrita (Tessa Perrin), Diane Robert (Nathalie Perrin), Romane Portail (Marianne Perrin), Bernard Verley (Christophe Perrin), Cyril Gueï (Adrien Ronsard), Marie Berto (Thérèse Dumay), Vincent Primault (Lamoureux), Xavier Robic (Virgile Lefort)

Genre: detective

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
14 May 1610, assassination of Henri IV/11 September 1973, the other 11 September
The assassination of King Henri IV, peacemaker and reformer, precipitated a major evolution, sanctifying the royal state. Before its memory was shrouded by the terrorist attacks of 2001, 11 September referred to the coup d'état by Chilean armed forces, overthrowing the socialist Popular Unity government and driving Allende to suicide.
Directed by: Pascal Goblot, Denis Van Waerebeke (France, 2019-2020)

programme.title: Rassemblance
programme.desc:
Sanaa (Mauritania-Morocco)
Moroccan mother, Mauritanian father: Sanaa Saitouli grew up in Cergy-Pointoise, between three cultures. Totally committed to helping local associations, standing for the municipal then parliamentary elections, mother and married to a Burkinabé, she does all she can to support others in her neighbourhood on their chosen route through life.
With Magloire Delcros-Varaud. Directed by: Yaëlle Benaim (France, 2022)

programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 8 Fred Pellerin has just launched the FOC certification for produce made in Saint-Élie-de-Caxton. Should feminine hygiene products be subsidised? Stéphane Lemire has enabled over seven thousand elderly citizens to continue living at home. Ghayda Hassan is working to prevent violent radicalization. La Tablée des Chefs redistributes surplus food. Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Granville, childhood home of Christian Dior Impossible to understand the style of the fashion designer Christian Dior without understanding his Normandy origins. He grew up in a pink house, perched on the cliffs of Granville, looking out over the English Channel. An exploration of this town steeped in character, once home to corsairs and privateers.

programme.title: Les rencontres du Papotin
programme.desc:
Guest: Virginie Efira, actress.
Since she first came to public notice on the small screen, Virginie Efira has become unmissable at the cinema, with some thirty feature films to her credit. Questioned about her childhood, her career choices or her relationship with society at large, she shares her thoughts and feeling with complete sincerity.
Chaired by: Julien Bancilhon. Directed by: Henri Poulain (France, 2023)

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.sub-title: Le Pays de Nancy et le Lunévillois
programme.desc:
Season: 2021

The Pays de Nancy and the Lunévillois

We head for north-eastern France to meet Véronique, using permaculture methods to grow cut-flowers and vegetables. On a farm handed down from generation to generation, Sabine grows cherry plums and distils Lorraine whisky. We explore Jean-Marie Pelt's botanical garden, the Château de Lunéville, Bergamote de Nancy...

Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Taratata 100% live
programme.desc: Guests: Charlie Winston, Selah Sue, Skip the Use, Tessae. Presented by: Nagui.

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Arles and Van Gogh, its colours and his madness Arles is today indissociable from the work of the Dutch painter Vincent Van Gogh. It was on its riverbanks that he painted some of his most beautiful masterpieces, such as the vibrant sunflower series. Shimmering colours that, along with the limpid skies he observed, ignited his creative ener-gy.

programme.title: Meurtres à Amiens
programme.desc:
On a canal amidst the "hortillonnages", the floating market gardens of Amiens, a lifeless body is found in a Nautilus-shaped fun-fair gondola. Inspector Monet and his assistant Barnier head the investigation. The victim, a seemingly ordinary woman, was apparently threatened ambitious plans for a Jules Verne theme park.

Directed by: Vincent Trisolini (France, 2021)

Screenplay by: Natascha Cucheval, Cécile Lorne

Cast: Grégoire Bonnet (Monet), Joyce Bibring (Léa), Anne Loiret (Eléonore), Célia Rosich (Charlotte), Aladin Reibel (Jelenski), Janis Abrikh (Gaspard), Nicolas Grandhomme (Philippe), Xavier Robic (Jauffert), Anthony Goffi (Max), Julien Desjardins (Thomas), Pascal Casanova (Paul Chevrier)

Genre: thriller

programme.title: Sibovoyage
programme.desc: From Rasht to Dushanbe (Tajikistan) Tajikistan, the smallest country in Central Asia, shares its borders with Afghanistan, China, Kirghizstan and Uzbekistan, and only became independent in 1991. We discover some of its many facets as we set of from the Kyrgyz border and journey to Dushanbe, its capital. Directed by: Thierry Perouse, Sabine de Heaulme (Belgium, 2019)

programme.title: Petits arrangements avec les morts
programme.desc:
It's the story of a sandcastle, of the man building it and of those who watch, on a beach in Brittany. All have had to learn to live with the loss of someone close…

Directed by: Pascale Ferran (France, 1994)

Cast: Charles Berling, Didier Sandre, Alexandre Zloto

Genre: Drama

Awards: Caméra d'Or (Cannes 1994), Bayard d'Or (FIFF Namur 1994)

programme.title: Le crime lui va si bien
programme.desc:
In a little country village, a famous writer dies in a car accident. Inspector Gaby Molina, convinced it was murder, takes over the investigation but has to work with Lieutenant Céline Richer, newly arrived from Paris, as her partner. A team as atypical as it is explosive, but particularly effective...

Directed by: Stéphane Kappes (France, 2019)

Screenplay: Olga Vincent, Stéphane Kaminka

Cast: Claudia Tagbo (Gaby Molina), Hélène Seuzaret (Céline Richer), Stéphane Freiss (Edouard Perret), Guillaume Denaiffe (Simon Landrau), Julien Ratel (Darget), Bruno Lochet (Anton Vargas), Laurent Manzoni (Félix Fontan)

Genre: detective

Awards: 2019 French language television film Grand Prize at the Cognac Crime Mystery Festival
